GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Pest Academy of Commerce in 1857. Re-established as Budapest Business School (Budapesti Gazdasági Főiskola) in 2000. Acquired University of Applied Sciences status in 2013 and became Budapest Business University in 2023.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány)

Address.college_name: Budapest University of Technology and Economics

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1782 as Institutum Geometricum Hydrotechnicum, acquired University status 1871. Reorganized 1949 as Technical University of Budapest incorporating former Technical University of Building and Transport Engineering, founded 1952. Acquired present title 2000. Under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Culture and Education and financed by the State
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány) and entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Faculty of Economics of the Royal Hungarian University of Budapest in 1920. Became part of the Hungarian University of Economics in 1948. Academic programme divided into three faculties in 1952. Reorganized as Budapest University of Economic Sciences in 1990. Became Budapest University of Economic Sciences and Public Administration (BUESPA) in 2000. Integrated the former University of Horticulture and Food Industry (3 faculties of Szent István University) BUESPA in 2003. Acquired present status and title in 2004
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány); Entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Created 2012 following merger of Zrínyi Miklós National Defence University (created 2009), the Police College of Hungary (created 2009), and Faculty of Public Administration of Corvinus University of Budapest (created 2008)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1769 as Faculty of Medicine of the Pázmány Péter University in 1769. Re-established as separate Institution in 1951. Acquired present status and title in 2000
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány); Entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1921, formerly Academy of Law established 1785, and succeeding University of Pécs founded 1367 by King Louis I. Faculties of Theology and Medicine detached and re-established as separate Institutions 1949 and 1951. Faculty of Teacher Training incorporated and acquired present title 1982. Due to changes in the Hungarian higher education system, Janus Pannonius University Pécs, Pécs University Medical School and Illyés Gyula College of Education, Szekszárd merged as University of Pécs and acquired present status and title 2000
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány) or equivalent and entrance examination

Divisions.College: DevelopmentCultural Sciences, Education and Regional Development

Address.university_name: Andrássy Gyula Budapesti Német Nyelvű Egyetem – Gyula Andrássy German-Speaking University of Budapest

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 2001. German language university - all teaching and research carried out in German.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1865
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány); Admissions examination

GeneralInformation.History: Established in 2000 and began operations in 2001. Previously known as Budapesti Kommunikációs és Üzleti Főiskola (University of Applied Sciences, Budapest). Acquired present title in 2015

Created as a National Rabbi Training Institute in 1877. Now provides secular training and studies in addition to religious training. The oldest continuously operating rabbinical institute in continental Europe
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1993 when the Szolnok branches of the Budapest based College of Commerce and Catering and the College of Foreign Trade merged
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1992
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány); Admissions interview

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1991. Acquired present title in 1999 and status in 2006
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány)

GeneralInformation.History: Formerly known as JánosHarsányi College
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1870. Acquired present status and title in 1996
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to June (September - February; February - June)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány); Certificate of English proficiency; Medical Certificate; Background Check

GeneralInformation.History: The predecessor of Eötvös Loránd University (ELTE) was founded in the rural town of Nagyszombat (today: Trnava, Slovakia) in 1635 by Cardinal Péter Pázmány, as a catholic university for teaching Theology and Philosophy. In 1770-1780, the University was transferred to Buda and later to Pest, and with the support of Maria Theresa, the Empress of Austria and Queen of Hungary, became the Royal Hungarian University.Over the following decades, new faculties were established to meet the expectations of a learned society. In the second half of the 19th century, the University developed into a centre of modern higher education in today's sense. In 1950, the university was reorganized and adopted its present name. It was named after one of its professors, the world-famous physicist, Loránd Eötvös. Over the last hundred years, Eötvös Loránd University (ELTE) has had many world famous scientists and four Nobel Prize laureates among its teachers and alumni
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány); Entrance examination; Language examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1774. Incorporated Teachers' Training College in 1828, became Eszterházy Károly Teacher Training College (Eszterházy Károly Tanárképző Főiskola) in 1990, then Eszterházy Károly College (Eszterházy Károly Főiskola) in 2000 and acquired current title and status 2021.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1930. Earned present title in 2008
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as State Institute of Ballet in 1950. Acquired present status and title in 1990
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate; Adequate dance training; Audition

Address.college_name: Hungarian University of Agriculture and Life Sciences

GeneralInformation.History: Created in 2000 as Szent István Egyetem (University of Saint Stephen) following the merger of Gödöllő University of Agricultural Sciences, University of Veterinary Science, University of Horticulture and Food Industry, Jászberény Teacher Training College, and Yászberény Teacher Training College. In 2016 added the faculties of Food Science, Horticultural Science, and Landscape Architecture and Urbanism of Corvinus University of Budapest. In 2020, Kaposvár University, the Károly Róbert Campus (Gyöngyös) of Eszterházy University and the Georgikon Faculty (Keszthely) of Pannon University were added to the university. Acquired current title 2021
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyĺtvány); Entrance examination

Divisions.College: Health Care and Environmental Sanitation Studies

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1871. Acquired status as University of Fine Arts in 2001
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyĺtvány); Presentation of original work

Divisions.College: Artistic Anatomy and Geometry and Projection

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1991. Acquired present status and title in 1997
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate; Certificate of English proficiency

GeneralInformation.History: Founded after the merger between Szolnok branches of the College of Commerce, Catering and Tourism and the College of Foreign trade in 1993

Address.college_name: Károli Gáspár University of the Reformed Church in Hungary

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1855. Acquired present status and title 1990
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány); Entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Earned approval from the government in 1991. Established in 1992. Initiated tourism and hotel program in 1993.Earned the Hungarian Quality e-learning Award for distance learning program in 2006.Completed university status in 2018
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1875. Reorganized due to changes in the Hungarian higher education system in 1971. Acquired present status and title under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Culture and Education in 2000
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate; Entrance examination

Address.university_name: Milton Friedman Egyetem – King Sigismund College

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as King Sigismund College in 2000. Earned present status and title in 2018. Operating under the United Hungarian Jewish Community since 2018
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Hungarian Royal Institute of Arts and Crafts in 1880. Acquired present status in 1971, and title in 2006. Financed by the state
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány); Entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1395. Óbuda University is the legal successor of the Public Secondary Industrial School of Budapest, established in 1879 and the Hungarian Royal Public Training School of Mechanics and Watchmaking, established in 1889. Óbuda University’s direct predecessor is Budapest Tech, 2000. Acquired present title 2010
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány); Curriculum Vitae; Certification of English Language Proficiency

Divisions.College: Light Industry and Environmental Protection Engineering

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1635 as Department of Theology of the University founded by Péter Pázmány, Cardinal, Primate, and Archbishop of Esztergom in Nagyszombat. Acquired present status and title in 1993. An ecclesiastic institution recognized by the State. Under supervision of the Holy See.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyĺtvány); Entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as a Jesuit academy in 1718. Re-established as Technical College of Transport and Telecommunications in 1968. Law program incorporated in 2002
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány); Entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Royal Hungarian University of Debrecen in 1912. Acquired present status and title as University of Debrecen in 2000
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyĺtvány) or foreign equivalent; Entrance examination; Medical certificate: Curriculum vitæ

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Higher Technical School of Metallurgy (FKT) in 1962 Earned present title in 2016
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány) or foreign equivalent; Curriculum Vitæ; Letter of Motivation; Certificate of English proficiency; Medical Certificate

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as a School of Mining in 1735. Earned initial status as an academy in 1770. Acquired present status and title in 1990
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány); Entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as a result of the merger of György Bessenyei Teachers Training College (1962) and the Nyíregyháza Agricultural College Faculty of the Agricultural University of Gödöllő (1961) in 2000. Earned present status as a university of applied sciences in 2016
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyítvány); Medical Certificate

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Faculty of the Technical University of Budapest in 1949. Became Veszprém University of Chemical Engineering in 1951. The Georgikon Faculty of Agriculture of the Pannon University of Agricultural Sciences attached to the University in 1989. Faculty of Teacher Training started in 1990. Obtained current title and status in 2006
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyitvány); Entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as a school for training mining officers in 1735. Earned present title in 1996
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate; Entrance examination

Divisions.College: Visual Arts and Music, Education and Sport

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Hungarian Royal University of Kolozsvar in 1872. Renamed Ferencz-Joseph University of Kolozvar in 1881. Relocated to Szeged in 1921. Merged as University of Szeged in 2000
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (érettségi bizonyitvány); Entrance examination
